metadata.Title: CVE-2012-3464 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in activesupport/lib/active_support/core_ext/string/output_safety.rb in Ruby on Rails before 3.0.17, 3.1.x before 3.1.8, and 3.2.x before 3.2.8 might allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving a ' (quote) character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-3464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ruby-activesupport-3.2 - 3.2.6-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby-activesupport-3.2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.2.6-5').
